IDS_PUEP517_HAIDA_COMMONWEALTH_DESCRIPTI: In commemoration of the hard work and glorious feats of Commonwealth destroyers in times of war. We honor the traditions of the Navy!
IDS_PURCHASE_PREMIUM_WARNING_NEXT_BATTLE: Warships Premium Account will become effective from the next battle.
IDS_PURCHASE_SHIP_TO_SEE_MODERNIZATIONS: Purchase the ship to view upgrades
IDS_PUSC506_DESCR: This warship was built in the UK, based on a reworked design of Leander-class cruisers with a modified arrangement of the propulsion unit. She was similar to her prototype in terms of armament, but had a different armor layout. In 1939, the ship was commissioned into the Royal Australian Navy.
IDS_PUSD503_DESCR: One in a series of advantageous Type 5 flotilla leaders designed and built for the Royal Navy. In 1933, the ship was transferred to the Royal Australian Navy. During World War II, she was slightly upgraded and partially rearmed.
IDS_PUSD507_DESCR: A Tribal-class destroyer built for the Royal Canadian Navy. In contrast to British ships of the series that were commissioned before the beginning of World War II, she had stronger AA defenses installed in place of one of the main battery mounts.
IDS_PVE_BATTLE_DESCRIPTION: Complete tasks as described in the scenario and receive rewards.
IDS_PVE_DIVISION_MATCHMAKER_CONFIG_AVAIL: Only the Division Commander can change the settings for entering battle
IDS_PVE_DIVISION_MATCHMAKER_NOT_AVAILABL: Automatic selection of allies is available only for the Operation of the Week
IDS_PVE_DIVISION_MATCHMAKER_OFF_INFO: Only your Division mates will take part in the battle
IDS_PVE_DIVISION_MATCHMAKER_ON_INFO: The allies used to complete the operation will be selected automatically
IDS_PVE_HARD_MODE_DISABLED: Hard difficulty will become available in future updates
IDS_PVE_OPERATION_BEST_RESULT_DATE: You achieved your best result on: %(bestDoneDate)s
IDS_PVE_OPERATION_HINT_0: Operations are battles that follow unique scenarios.
IDS_PVE_OPERATION_HINT_1: Your allies can be automatically selected for the Operation of the Week.
IDS_PVE_OPERATION_HINT_2: To complete other operations, you need to assemble a Division by yourself. The minimum number of participants is %(minPlayers)s.
IDS_PVE_OPERATION_IS_NOT_DONE: You failed to complete the operation
IDS_PVSC507_DESCR: A Brooklyn-class light cruiser built for the US Navy. Her main battery consisted of fifteen 152 mm guns that had a very high rate of fire. In 1951, she was transferred to the Argentine Navy.
IDS_PWEP502_BLYSKAWICA_SZARZA_DESCRIPTIO: Permanent camouflage created by the player nicknamed Pecztery for destroyer Błyskawica. The concept, titled Szarza, took first prize in the camouflage design competition.
IDS_PWEP503_BLYSKAWICA_303_DESCRIPTION: A tribute to 303 Squadron, which participated in The Battle of Britain
IDS_PWSB504_DESCR: The lead ship of the sole series of the Austro-Hungarian Navy dreadnoughts. By applying a rather heavy arrangement, the designers were able to create a well-armored battleship of a relatively small size, with powerful weapons consisting of twelve 305 mm main battery guns.
IDS_PWSC101_DESCR: A minelayer ship that was also designed to serve as a training ship. Built in France for the Polish Navy; armed with artillery made in Sweden.
IDS_PWSD102_DESCR: A series of the best destroyers of the Austro-Hungarian Navy that were built as part of the naval program and intended to equip the navy with more advanced ships. The artillery for the destroyers was supplied by the Czech company Škoda.
IDS_PWSD103_DESCR: A Spica-class destroyer built for the Italian Navy and transferred to Sweden in 1940. The ship was notable for her compact dimensions and the peculiar arrangement of her torpedo tubes.
IDS_PWSD104_DESCR: A \"standard\" Swedish destroyer, commissioned as part of one of several ongoing series of destroyers that commenced in the late 1920s. The features that all the ships of this series shared were their high speeds, 120 mm Bofors main guns, and 533 mm torpedo tubes.
IDS_PWSD105_DESCR: A further development of the \"standard\" destroyers of the Swedish Navy. The ship was faster than her predecessors, had a different main-gun-mount arrangement, and carried reinforced anti-aircraft armament.
IDS_PWSD106_DESCR: The design of a large, fast-moving, and well-armed destroyer, developed by Swedish shipbuilders for the Polish Navy. All of her main battery artillery was placed in twin mounts.
IDS_PWSD107_DESCR: The design of a destroyer armed with dual-purpose main battery artillery. The ship served as a prototype for the Swedish Öland-class destroyers that were commissioned after World War II.
IDS_PWSD108_DESCR: A destroyer built on the basis of the experience gained during World War II. The ship's powerful AA defenses were provided by semi-automatic, dual-purpose main battery mounts and a large number of automatic AA guns.
IDS_PWSD109_DESCR: Last of a series of destroyers of the Swedish Navy. Due to their dimensions, which were quite small for the era, they are sometimes classified as \"light\" destroyers. Their main artillery armament comprised very successful 120 mm automatic dual-purpose mounts.
IDS_PWSD110_DESCR: The largest and most powerful destroyers in the Swedish Navy. Their main advantages were their powerful AA defenses and extremely rapid-firing main battery artillery.
IDS_PWSD501_DESCR: The most powerful destroyer of her time in Europe. The ship greatly surpassed rival navies' destroyers in terms of speed and artillery power. When commissioned, she had the most powerful AA defense among all destroyers in the world. Błyskawica is now preserved as a military museum ship in Gdynia, Poland.
IDS_PWSD508_DESCR: An M-class destroyer built for the Royal Navy, but transferred to the Polish Navy shortly after being commissioned. Despite similarities with Lightning-class ships, Orkan boasted stronger AA defenses which were reinforced at the cost of a reduced number of torpedo tubes.
IDS_PWSD510_DESCR: The lead ship in a series of \"submarine hunters\" used by the Dutch Navy. The ship carried various anti-submarine weapons as well as 120 mm Bofors dual purpose naval guns, one of the most effective pieces of armament during the post-war period.
IDS_PWSD610_DESCR: One of the largest and most powerful destroyers in the Swedish Royal Navy, armed with highly effective 120 mm main guns that boasted a high rate of fire. The ship's distinctive feature was her torpedo launchers with different numbers of tubes.
IDS_PWSD910_DESCR: The largest and most powerful destroyers in the Swedish Navy. Their main advantages were their strong AA defenses and extremely rapid-firing main battery artillery.
IDS_PXES300_MONTANA_HW19_DESCRIPTION: Her enemies will surely shed true, not crocodile tears—this mighty leviathan will elicit the most honest of emotions!
IDS_PXES330_YAMATO_HW19_DESCRIPTION: Deadly red-hot claws and a sharp lead sting—that's what her inevitable retaliation looks like!
IDS_PXES430_HENRI_HW19_DESCRIPTION: This child of the smashing magic of the Earth is as impregnable as a stronghold, and as daunting as the shadows of the Twilight.
IDS_PXES470_ALASKA_HW19_DESCRIPTION: This bionic construct has spread its iron tentacles and is now fully ready to conquer the high seas.
IDS_PXES530_KHABAROVSK_HW19_DESCRIPTION: Just its appearance is enough for this gigantic Scylla-like organism to inspire terror and primal fear in its enemies.
IDS_PXES540_SHIMAKAZE_HW19_DESCRIPTION: Legends speak of the Angler's mastery of tracking and striking any careless prey. This sharp-toothed spawn of hell owns everything it meets on its way!
IDS_PXSA003_DESCR: Nobilium, the pinnacle of engineering excellence built on the experiences of the past and discoveries of the future. The ship's hull is made of a rare sky alloy. Apart from sophisticated aircraft, carriers are armed with ancient artifacts. Any of the carriers can use those artifacts to disable enemy ships and restore the HP of allies.\n\nDamage dealt by the Filth: 500 HP per second.
IDS_PXSA005_DESCR: A heavy shield carrier mother ship of the Federation designed to explore the most distant corners of outer space. The series of this ship saw about ten versions and editions.
IDS_PXSB002_DESCR:
Long-range combat warship.
Difficulty: high.

A mysterious battleship, the enigmatic flagship of the Twilight Fleet. Little is known about her place of construction, and even less about who and why designed and built this ship. Those who have encountered her in combat recount that Rasputin is somehow capable of affecting the human mind by depriving the rivaling Commanders of the ability to give orders.
IDS_PXSB004_DESCR: The lead ship in a series of Pallad-class battleships. The mechanisms implemented in the ship's design allow her to temporarily stay invulnerable to all known types of armament. The repair teams aboard those ships are the best in all Intania: they are so skilled that they can repair nearby allied ships even during battle.\n\nDamage dealt by the Filth: 200 HP per second.
IDS_PXSB005_DESCR:
Short-range combat warship.
Difficulty: high.

Varg, a cursed flagship of a pirate squadron emerging from the fog of the North Sea and disappearing without a trace among mesmerizing fjords. Like its captain, the ship is immortal. Through many centuries its hull became rigid, growing stronger than steel to make it immune to damage for a brief period of time. Varg's aura sucks vital energy out of any reckless ship that dares approach it.
IDS_PXSB006_DESCR: The first heavy combat spacecraft of the Federation to be propelled by a warp drive. Images of the open-worked structure of her turret are often used for creating propaganda materials.
IDS_PXSB007_DESCR: A conventional heavy warship of the Federation's enemy, built a long time ago in a far-off galaxy. Vulnerable to bombers.
IDS_PXSB008_DESCR:
Long-range combat warship.
Difficulty: low.

Leviathan is a chthonic sea dragon called in from neighboring reality planes, and tricked into service by a cunning warlock captain. The skin of this sea monster is no longer that strong. Yet, powered by the wisdom of centuries, this ancient creature can strike enemies with exceptional accuracy, while rituals held on the captain's bridge can "feed" all nearby allies with vital energy.
IDS_PXSB009_DESCR: A cyborg ship whose mechanical sting scares even the most battle-hardened opponents.
IDS_PXSB010_DESCR: A wanderer that came into the Twilight World to rob her enemies!
IDS_PXSB011_DESCR: A huge symbiotic ship that has survived several global extinctions thanks to her infernal magic and sharp teeth. She carries the strong armor of a giant crocodilomorph, and has a tremendous cargo hold for looted goods!
IDS_PXSC002_DESCR:
Long-range combat warship.
Difficulty: high.

A floating temple of Set built on the precepts of the Ancient Forerunners. With every hit it deals, Scarab will take away a portion of a target's vital energy. Scarab's pseudo-biotic armor can devour the energy of damage dealt to recover the ship's own HP.
IDS_PXSC003_DESCR: Svyatozar cruisers are the eyes of Intania's fleet. They carry a system of optical lenses and prisms that can detect enemy ships, even through the thickness of the Filth. These cruisers can deliver a squall of fire for a short time, eliminating everything that gets in their way. The more damage dealt to enemy ships, the stronger the cruiser gets.\n\nDamage dealt by the Filth: 100 HP per second.
IDS_PXSC004_DESCR: The pride and glory of the Federation Space Fleet, this Galaxy-class cruiser is the lead ship in a series of heavy cruisers constructed over the course of the war between the Federation and the Robots.
IDS_PXSC005_DESCR: Zaya is a renegade ship from the Enlightenment's 44th Eastern Fleet. Zaya's avatar joined the Space Fleet of Earth to study the relationships between humans and the Enlightenment, with the purpose of enhancing tactical programs after the incident involving the 22nd Eastern Fleet.
IDS_PXSC006_DESCR: A maneuverable frigate design featuring the most advanced stealth technologies. One of the most tactically powerful representatives of her type. It's ideally suited for annihilating representatives of extra-terrestrial civilizations.
IDS_PXSC007_DESCR: An Aurora-class medium cruiser created by the race of the Elders for conducting war against the representatives of the Phantoms.
IDS_PXSC009_DESCR:
Long-range combat warship.
Difficulty: low.

Octopus, one of the numerous spawns of the Great Kraken which, through the power of the Filth, was fused with the wreckage of a ship that sank a long time ago. Its corroded guns cannot boast a decent rate of fire, but the rusted shells can burn the enemy literally with one volley. The cruiser is endowed with an ability to heal allies using the energy it takes from the abyss of the sea.
IDS_PXSC010_DESCR: Century Hawk—a legendary ship. The hull of the cruiser is made from the lightest, yet strongest Sarcasium-Ironium alloy to protect its crew from any threat, while the ship's shells containing enriched Lolinit can reach any target.
IDS_PXSC011_DESCR: This ship was built by crazy mechanics for one purpose only: to grab the spoils of war with her steel tentacles!
IDS_PXSC012_DESCR: A ship capable of finding enemies and prey within a radius of 12 kilometers.
IDS_PXSC013_DESCR: A monstrous creature—a petrified ghoul that steals vital energy away from her enemies and uses it to protect herself against damage.
IDS_PXSD002_DESCR:
Short-range combat warship
Difficulty: low

Ghoul is a ghost ship molded from the parts of various monsters and revitalized with the magic of Victor F. Einstein. The sea folk of Intania say that if you let the crippled Ghoul disappear from sight for only a minute, she will come back without fail, intact, and ready to bring doom upon every living creature.
IDS_PXSD003_DESCR: These destroyers were specifically designed by the best engineers to carry out reconnaissance raids across dangerous waters far from the shores of the Silver Spear Archipelago. Each Urashima destroyer carries a cleansing boiler that speeds the ship up and increases her HP by absorbing the dark energy of the Filth.\n\nDamage dealt by the Filth: 10 HP per second.
IDS_PXSD004_DESCR: An ordinary ship of the Calmbook class, one of the best known and most numerous series of spaceship. They were the workhorses piloted by many space adventurers.
IDS_PXSD005_DESCR: An annihilating annihilator intended for annihilating the annihilators' enemies. The only ship in a series that was under the command of Cheater the Great, the hero of the Battle of the Large Talos in 5087.
IDS_PXSD008_DESCR:
Long-range combat warship.
Difficulty: high.

Inconspicuous in appearance, Steel Rat is equipped with highly sophisticated and cutting-edge tools and mechanisms. Though vulnerable in a face-to-face encounter, this destroyer can be a real game changer by promptly recovering allied ships' HP and replenishing their supplies of consumables.
IDS_PXSD009_DESCR:
Long-range combat warship.
Difficulty: high.

A biomechanical construct, a spy ship ideal for special operations, chasing its prey or escaping from pursuit. Quick as a guillotine, hard as a hammer, tough like her captain and capable of anchoring fast to her prey. "Why Razorworm?" you might ask. 'Cause it's hard as hell to hit.
IDS_PXSD010_DESCR: A defending defender assigned to defend defenders. The favorite ship of, but not the only one helmed by, Commander LilFish OG.
IDS_PXSD011_DESCR: Comet Trace, a representative of the third generation of Calmbook-class ships. In contrast to her predecessors, Comet Trace is highly maneuverable and boasts reinforced rocket armament and blasters.
IDS_PXSD012_DESCR: The first stellar destroyer co-designed by the Green and Red Alliances. Created specifically for battles in Torpedo Beat mode, this ship alone can stir up trouble on a galactic scale.
IDS_PXSD013_DESCR: The first in a series of Octopus-class ships. As hard to detect as a mouse trap, and as deadly as a rusty knife smeared with rat poison!
IDS_PXSD014_DESCR: The first in a series of Moray Eel-class ships. A master of skillful maneuvering, equipped with a powerful engine—an ideal choice for all enthusiasts of daring attacks at knife duel distances.
IDS_PXSD015_DESCR: The first in a series of Barracuda-class ships. Powered by the energy of nuclear fusion, chaotically blended with the wrathful force of her Commander—her high speeds and powerful main battery guns leave her enemies in her wake and lay waste to those who provoke her rage.
IDS_PXSD016_DESCR: A further development of the Octopus-class ships. She carries an enhanced Smoke Generator consumable and is capable of delivering a devastating blow by unleashing 15 torpedoes—enough to make enemies wish for another doomsday.
IDS_PXSD017_DESCR: A further development of the Moray Eel-class ships. This destroyer comes with an enhanced Torpedo Reload Booster consumable. Like an adroit surgeon's scalpel, it can change the course of a battle with a single precise strike.
IDS_PXSD018_DESCR: A further development of the Barracuda-class ships. As fast as a waterspout, this ship is equipped with highly accurate main guns and an enhanced Repair Party consumable, all owing to its Commander: a half-life half-genius who collected all the necessary spare parts from the ruins of the dead civilization.
IDS_PXSD019_DESCR: The epitome of design for the Octopus-class ships. Her tube-by-tube torpedo launching capability and an improved Hydroacoustic Search consumable make her precise and evasive. She's a predator whose actions are as unpredictable as the logic of the inhabitants of the dying world.
IDS_PXSD020_DESCR: The epitome of design for the Barracuda-class ships. Quick as a guillotine, hard as a hammer, as tough as her Captain. Nothing will prevent her from anchoring fast to her prey. Why do they call her Seascythe? Because no one can catch up to her, and she will cut through the hulls of her enemies with the relentless fire of her fast-reloading battery.
IDS_PXSD021_DESCR: The epitome of design for the Moray Eel-class ships, and a veteran of the fuel wars who felt the fading of the Sun on the metal of her decks. She's a fierce warrior who knows no mercy. With fantastic maneuverability, four torpedo launchers, and an improved Engine Boost consumable, she may well be the last sight that her enemies’ irradiated eyes see.
IDS_PXSD022_DESCR: A ravenous Angler ship, ready to consume anything that fits into her toothy cargo hold.
IDS_PXSD023_DESCR: A destroyer that is as fast as the spread of the Twilight. Like a true lancet, she is able to shape the course of action.
IDS_PXSD024_DESCR: A ship with looks that will make the blood freeze in your veins.
IDS_PXSS107_DESCR: The smallest submarine of the Kingdom of Intania. Initially intended for the defense of overseas possessions and coastal cities, this sub turned out to be an excellent reconnaissance boat capable of delivering lightning-fast attacks on enemy harbors.
IDS_PXSS207_DESCR: Designed by Antanas Drive Yards; Seelöwe is specifically designed to deliver quick and painful strikes. Separate loading of the sub's three torpedo launchers located in the fore lets this deepwater predator prepare for a forward attack in a short time.
IDS_PXSS307_DESCR: High underwater endurance lets these deep-sea predators, codenamed \"Gerfalcon\", sneak deep into the enemy's combat formation undetected. From there they can subject an entire squadron to massive damage and get away with it, silently vanishing in the depths of the sea.
IDS_PXSS407_DESCR: Barracuda is an experimental submarine equipped with main guns that can make things take an unpleasant turn even for a battleship. A horrid combination of torpedo and gun armament will let this boat come out victorious even in on-surface encounters.
IDS_PXSS507_DESCR: The lead ship in a series of steam-powered submarines codenamed \"Expert\". Designed to be a perfect weapon, this submarine received powerful armament located fore and aft, with excellent agility and speed for this type of sub. The final price, however, coming in astonishingly high.
IDS_PXSX015_DESCR: Half Shark, half Shrimp.\nUseful life: one week; to be stored in cold water. When her useful life expires, you are left with a slot.
IDS_PZEP506_ANSHAN_DESCRIPTION: Decreases the firing accuracy of the enemy, reduces ship detectability and increases the amount of XP earned by the ship and her Commander as well as Free XP earned in a battle.
IDS_PZES406_HUANG_HE_NY_DESCRIPTION: Dedicated to the Lunar New Year.
IDS_PZES408_IRIAN_NY_DESCRIPTION: Dedicated to the Lunar New Year. Garuda, the king of birds, will be your guardian.
IDS_PZES506_ANSHAN_NY_DESCRIPTION: Dedicated to the Lunar New Year.
IDS_PZES508_LOYANG_NY_DESCRIPTION: Dedicated to the Lunar New Year. The true Foo Dog will protect your ship!
IDS_PZSB509_DESCR: Bajie is half-man, half-pig, and one of the main mythological characters in Chinese culture. A wizard who achieved immortality, but was later expelled from the heavens to walk the earth as a punishment for his human passions.
IDS_PZSC101_DESCR: This small escort ship (Kaibōkan) was built during World War II for the Imperial Japanese Navy. In 1947, she was transferred to the Republic of China.
IDS_PZSC506_DESCR: A U.K. light cruiser intended for service within a squadron, for carrying out close reconnaissance and counter-destroyer missions. In 1948, the ship was transferred to the Republic of China Navy but joined the PLA Navy a year later, becoming its most powerful combat unit. In the early 1950s, a plan was drawn up for the refurbishment of the cruiser by replacing her weapons and equipment with Soviet-made models.
IDS_PZSC508_DESCR: This Project 68-bis light cruiser, built for the Soviet Navy, had good AA defenses and carried twelve 152 mm guns with a very long range of fire. In 1963, the ship joined the Indonesian Navy.
IDS_PZSC518_DESCR: Wukong is the Monkey King and one of the main mythological characters in Chinese culture. He is an immortal demon who obtained extraordinary power after long years of wandering and spiritual perfection.
IDS_PZSD102_DESCR: In 1913, this destroyer was ordered from Germany in order to reinforce the Republic of China Navy with up-to-date ships. She was never built, but her design formed the basis for German V-25 destroyers.
IDS_PZSD103_DESCR: A British destroyer of the R class, designed by John I. Thornycroft & Co. The ship was transferred to the Thai Navy in 1920. She could travel at a very high speed and carried very good armament. For most of her service life, she was the most powerful torpedo ship in the Thai Navy.
IDS_PZSD104_DESCR: Former Japanese destroyer of the Minekaze class that had some distinctions from the lead ship of the series. She was transferred to the Republic of China Navy in 1947, with all Japanese armament being demounted.
IDS_PZSD105_DESCR: Developed in Britain, the design of this destroyer flotilla leader was offered to the Government of the Republic of China in 1929 (Project T.306), but it never materialized. The ship carried five main guns and two triple torpedo tubes.
IDS_PZSD106_DESCR: Soviet destroyer of the Gnevny class, that was transferred to the People's Republic of China Navy in 1954. She was fast and her main battery artillery was powerful enough for a ship of her type.
IDS_PZSD107_DESCR: The N-class destroyer. She was built in Britain and then transferred to the Royal Netherlands Navy. In 1951, the ship was sold to Indonesia. This destroyer, armed with powerful artillery guns and torpedo tubes, had a very successful design for her time.
IDS_PZSD108_DESCR: The Gleaves-class destroyer built for the U.S. Navy. The ship was transferred to the Republic of China in 1955. The ship's armament consisted of dual-purpose main battery guns and two quintuple torpedo tubes.
IDS_PZSD109_DESCR: The former U.S. Fletcher-class destroyer that was transferred to the Republic of Korea Navy in 1963. The ship carried good armament and had enhanced AA capabilities.
IDS_PZSD110_DESCR: Former U.S. destroyer of the Allen M. Sumner class that was transferred to the Republic of China Navy in 1970. She was developed from the very successful Fletcher class. In contrast to her predecessor, she had more powerful artillery, but ran at a lower speed.
IDS_PZSD208_DESCR: One of the destroyers built under Project 30-bis for the needs of the U.S.S.R. Navy after World War II as a further development of the Ognevoi-class ships. In 1959, the ship was transferred to the Navy of Indonesia.
IDS_PZSD506_DESCR: One of the Soviet destroyers built under Project 7. She had a high speed and powerful artillery. The ship was handed over to the Navy of the People's Republic of China in 1955. By that time, her AA defenses had been noticeably enhanced.
IDS_PZSD508_DESCR: A destroyer specifically built for the U.S. Navy, boasting powerful AA guns and a high speed. She was handed over to the Navy of the Republic of China in 1954. Her armament comprised dual-purpose main guns and quintuple torpedo tubes.

IDS_SIGNALS_REPLENISH_AUTOMATICALLY_HINT: A full set of mounted signals lasts for one battle.
If auto-resupply is enabled, the mounted signals will be resupplied automatically after each battle. If the required signals are available, they will be mounted without cost.
If there is not enough credits to resupply the full set of signals, you still can enter the battle with signals available for mounting, or without any signals at all.
If you do not have enough credits to resupply the full set of signals, auto-resupply is disabled automatically.

IDS_SKILL_CENTRALATBAMODIFIER: Manual Fire Control for Secondary Armament
IDS_SKILL_DESC_ACCURACYINCREASERATEMODIF: Improves the aiming time of the aircraft carrier's planes.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_ADDITIONALPLANESINSQUADMO: Increases the number of aircraft in squadrons.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_AIGUNSEFFICIENCYMODIFIER: Improves the effectiveness of main guns with a caliber up to and including 139 mm, secondary battery guns, and AA mounts.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_AIGUNSRANGEMODIFIER: Extends the firing range of main battery guns with a caliber up to and including 139 mm, as well as secondary battery guns. Increases the efficiency of AA mounts.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_AIMINGFIGHTERSPOINTMODIFI: When the Fighter consumable is activated, an additional aircraft is launched.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_AIRDEFENCEBARRAGEABILITY: Improves anti-aircraft performance for a limited time.\nAvailable on cruisers with dual-purpose guns (Anti-aircraft / Secondary armament).
IDS_SKILL_DESC_AIRGROUNDATTACKMODIFIER: Enables the player to manually specify an attack point for attack squadrons
IDS_SKILL_DESC_ALLSKILLSCOOLDOWNMODIFIER: Reduces the reload time of all consumables for the ship and squadrons.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_ARTILLERYALERTMODIFIER: A warning about a salvo fired at your ship from a distance of more than 4.5 km.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_AUTOREPAIRMODIFIER: Accelerates repairs to modules, firefighting, and recovery from flooding.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_CENTRALAIRDEFENCEMODIFIER:
Activation of a priority sector increases the amount of instantaneous damage dealt.

Selection of a priority sector no longer increases the continuous damage dealt by AA mounts.

Priority sector preparation time increases.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_CENTRALATBAMODIFIER: Secondary guns only fire at targets designated by the player.\nThe firing efficiency is significantly increased.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_EMERGENCYTEAMCOOLDOWNMODI: Reduces reload time of Damage Control Party.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_FIGHTEREFFICIENCYMODIFIER: Increases the attack power of fighters while in combat against higher-tier squadrons. The greater the difference between the tiers, the greater the damage.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_FIREPROBABILITYMODIFIER: Increases the chances of setting fire to the target for the armament carried by ships and aircraft.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_FIRERESISTANCEMODIFIER: Reduces the risk of fire.\nThe maximum number of fires on a ship is reduced to three.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_FLIGHTSPEEDMODIFIER: Increases the speed of the aircraft carrier's squadrons.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_FORSAGEDURATIONMODIFIER: Increases the engine boost time for the aircraft carrier's squadrons.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_FORSAGERESTORATIONMODIFIE: Completely restores the engine boost for the last attack flight of the aircraft carrier's planes.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_INTUITIONMODIFIER: Reduces the time taken to switch shell type if all main battery guns are loaded.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_LANDMINEEXPLODERMODIFIER: Improves the armor penetration capabilities of HE shells fired from both main and secondary battery guns.\nDecreases the chances of setting an enemy ship on fire with HE shells.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_LASTCHANCEMODIFIER: Increases the reload speed of all armaments as the ship's HP decreases.\n\nIncreases the speed of the aircraft carrier's squadrons as the aircraft's HP decreases.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_LASTEFFORTMODIFIER: When the engine or steering gears are incapacitated, they continue to operate but with a penalty.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_MAINGUNSROTATIONMODIFIER: Increases the traverse speed of main battery guns.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_METICULOUSPREVENTIONMODIF: Reduces the risk of main turrets, torpedo tubes, steering gears, and engine becoming incapacitated.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_NEARAURADAMAGETAKENMODIFI: Decreases the continuous damage taken by aircraft within the effective area of AA mounts.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_NEARENEMYINTUITIONMODIFIE:
Shows the direction to the nearest enemy ship or a submarine that is on the surface.
The enemy player will be alerted that a bearing was taken on their ship.

It does not work on aircraft carriers or submerged submarines.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_OUTOFATTACKMODIFIER: Decreases the airspeed of strike aircraft (bombers, attack aircraft and torpedo bombers), but also reduces their detectability and increases their HP when returning to the carrier.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_PARKINGDECKMODIFIER: Allows aircraft to take off and land on an aircraft carrier even when the carrier is on fire.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_PLANEPREPARINGMODIFIER: Decreases the service time and increases HP for carrier-based aircraft.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_PLANESVISIONMODIFIER: Increases viewing radius for all aircraft, including spotting aircraft
IDS_SKILL_DESC_PREPARINGONBOARDSHOOTERSM: Increases efficiency of self-defense armament of aircraft with rear gunners.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_PRIORITYTARGETMODIFIER: The detection indicator will show the number of opponents currently aiming at your ship with their main battery guns.\n\nFor an aircraft carrier's squadrons, the detection indicator will show the number of ships whose AA defenses are currently firing at your planes.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_REGENERATIONABILITY: Increases the efficiency of the Repair Party consumable.\nAvailable on battleships and some cruisers.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_SMOKESCREENABILITY: Improves smoke screen setting.\nAvailable on destroyers.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_SUPERINTENDENTMODIFIER: Increases the capacity of your ship's consumables.\n\nDoes not affect the consumables of aircraft carrier squadrons.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_SURVIVALMODIFIER: Increases HP of the ship and aircraft, including fighters.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_TORPEDOACCELERATORMODIFIE: Increases the speed of torpedoes launched from both ships and aircraft by reducing torpedo range.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_TORPEDOALERTNESSMODIFIER: Extends the torpedo acquisition range, even while the \"Hydroacoustic Search\" consumable is active.\n\nDoes not affect aircraft carrier squadrons.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_TORPEDORELOADMODIFIER: Reduces the reload time of torpedo tubes.
IDS_SKILL_DESC_VISIBILITYMODIFIER: Reduces the detectability range of the ship and the aircraft carrier's squadrons.
IDS_SKILL_EFFICIENCY_REDUSED: Effect of skill is reduced during retraining.
IDS_SKILL_LEARN_PREVIOUS_LEVEL: You must first master a skill from the preceding level.

IDS_SUBMARINE_TUTORIAL_ENERGY_DESCRIPTIO: Required in order to operate sonar.

IDS_SUBMARINE_TUTORIAL_PINGER_GUN_DESCRI: Hit special indicators on an enemy ship's hull with a sonar ping, either prior to or after launching torpedoes, to make them home in on the target automatically.
A second hit to any of the target ship's special indicators resets the duration of the sonar ping's effects.
When both special indicators are hit, torpedoes maneuver more effectively and negate the target ship's anti-torpedo protection.

IDS_SUBMARINE_WAVE_HIT_ADDED_2: Torpedoes will now ignore the target's anti-torpedo protection

IDS_TALENT_PAW102_ACHIEVEMENT_2_DESCRIPT: The Confederate achievement speeds up the reload time of the ship's armament and aircraft servicing.
IDS_TALENT_PAW102_ACHIEVEMENT_3_DESCRIPT: The Double Strike achievement reduces the detectability of your ship and aircraft carrier's squadrons.
IDS_TALENT_PBW100_ACHIEVEMENT_2_DESCRIPT: The \"Witherer\" achievement speeds up the reload time of the ship's main battery and torpedo tubes, and makes the servicing of squadrons faster.\n\nCan be activated only once per battle. Unavailable in Clan and Training Battles.
IDS_TALENT_PBW100_RIBBONS_0_DESCRIPTION: Destroy two ships to get additional charges for your ship's consumables. \nCan be activated only once per battle. Unavailable in Clan and Training Battles. Does not apply to the consumables of aircraft carrier squadrons.
IDS_TALENT_PBW100_RIBBONS_8_15_DESCRIPTI: Upon earning two \"Caused flooding\" ribbons, the speed of the ship and squadrons increases.\n\nCan be activated only once per battle. Unavailable in Clan and Training Battles.
IDS_TALENT_PFW405_ACHIEVEMENT_2_DESCRIPT: The Devastating Strike achievement speeds up the reload time of the ship's armament.
IDS_TALENT_PFW405_DAMAGE_8_DESCRIPTION: Every 2,000,000 HP of potential damage received increases your ship's speed by 8%.
IDS_TALENT_PFW405_RIBBONS_7_DESCRIPTION: Upon earning a \"Captured\" or \"Assisted in Capture\" ribbon, you get +1% to the chances of setting an enemy ship on fire with main battery shells.
IDS_TALENT_PGW103_RIBBONS_12_DESCRIPTION: Upon earning 30 \"Rocket Hits,\" \"Bomb Hits,\" or \"Torpedo Hits\" ribbons, aircraft servicing speeds up.
IDS_TALENT_PGW103_RIBBONS_13_DESCRIPTION: Upon earning 140 \"Main Battery Hits\" ribbons, the main battery firing rate increases.
IDS_TALENT_PGW103_RIBBONS_14_DESCRIPTION: Upon earning 100 \"Secondary Battery Hits\" ribbons, the secondary battery reload time decreases.
IDS_TALENT_PGW103_RIBBONS_1_DESCRIPTION: Upon earning three \"Spotted\" ribbons, your ship's HP gets restored. The talent's action time measured in seconds is equal to the ship's tier.
IDS_TALENT_PIW101_ACHIEVEMENT_2_DESCRIPT: The Confederate achievement speeds up the reload time of the ship's main battery.
IDS_TALENT_PIW101_RIBBONS_10_DESCRIPTION: Upon earning 100 \"Main Battery Hits\" ribbons, the action time of consumables increases.
IDS_TALENT_PIW101_RIBBONS_9_DESCRIPTION: When you destroy an enemy ship, your main battery's firing range increases.
IDS_TALENT_PJW018_ACHIEVEMENT_0_DESCRIPT: The First Blood achievement provides additional charges for any consumables mounted on a ship.\n\nDoes not affect the consumables of aircraft carrier squadrons.
IDS_TALENT_PJW018_ACHIEVEMENT_1_2_DESCRI: The \"Kraken Unleashed!\" achievement partially restores the ship's HP and speeds up the reload time of her armament and aircraft servicing.
IDS_TALENT_PRW406_ACHIEVEMENT_0_DESCRIPT: The First Blood achievement provides additional charges for any consumables mounted on a ship.\n\nDoes not affect the consumables of aircraft carrier squadrons.
IDS_TALENT_PRW406_HEALTH_1_5_6_DESCRIPTI:
The talent is activated if the ship's HP falls below 10%.

Partially restores the ship's HP.

Extinguishes fires, removes instances of flooding, and repairs damaged modules.

Temporarily increases the dispersion of shells fired by enemy ships.
IDS_TALENT_PWW010_RIBBONS_11_DESCRIPTION: Increases the torpedo reload speed for every 8 successful torpedo hits scored on the enemy.
IDS_TALENT_PWW010_RIBBONS_16_DESCRIPTION: Increases the continuous AA damage after 20 aircraft shot down.

IDS_TIPS_ACOUSTIC_TORPEDOES_HOMING_DESCR: Torpedoes fired by a submarine can home in on your ship.\n\nTurn your ship's bow towards any incoming torpedoes to reduce the risk of being hit.
IDS_TIPS_ACOUSTIC_TORPEDOES_MAGNETIC_FUS: Torpedoes equipped with a magnetic trigger ignore torpedo protection. They are most dangerous when hitting a ship's side.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCARRIER_AUTOMATIC_CONSUMABLE: The Damage Control Party consumable is used automatically when either fire or flooding happens, or when a module is incapacitated.\n\nThe Fighter is launched automatically, performs reconnaissance duties and repels air attacks when your aircraft carrier is detected by the enemy.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_AIR_DEFENSE_ENEMY_DESC: Dodge the tracer shells and AA gun shell explosions by changing the speed and direction of the squadron.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_CARRIER_CONTROL_DESCRI: If you are in squadron view mode, you can set the aircraft carrier's route and destination point using the Tactical Map [CMD_TACTICAL_MAP].
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_CARRIER_DESCRIPTION:
Aircraft carriers do not have main gun batteries. Their role in battle is to deliver air strikes against enemy forces and perform reconnaissance missions.

For the best results, try to keep close to the combat action zone, whilst remaining undetected by the enemy.
Aircraft carriers are vulnerable and should be covered at all times by allies.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_ATTACK_STATE_: A white aiming reticule on the water indicates the spot where your squadron will deliver the strike fully aimed. Press the LMB to instruct the squadron to make a run over the target. When the aiming reticule turns green, press the LMB to drop the payload. Note that accuracy deteriorates if you maneuver during the attack run. Once the attack run is complete, the squadron returns to the carrier.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_BOMBERS_AP_DE: This type of aircraft is armed with AP bombs that are efficient against moderately and heavily armored targets. Attack enemy ships from the fore or aft ends.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_BOMBERS_HE_DE: This type of aircraft is armed with HE bombs that can cause a fire on a ship. Attack enemy ships from the fore or aft ends.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_CONTROL_DESCR: Use the [CMD_THROTTLE_UP] and [CMD_THROTTLE_DOWN] keys to control the speed of your aircraft. Squadron acceleration and deceleration cause engine overheating. When aircraft are flying at cruising speed, their engines cool.\n\nUse the [CMD_TURN_LEFT] and [CMD_TURN_RIGHT] keys to change the direction of the aircraft.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_FIGHTERS_AP_D: Attack aircraft are effective against cruisers.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_FIGHTERS_DESC: Attack aircraft are effective against highly maneuverable targets.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_LEAD_DESCRIPT: Anticipate your targets by shooting ahead of them if they are in motion. The higher the ship's speed, the greater the lead required!
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_TORPERS_DESCR: This type of aircraft is armed with torpedoes that are efficient against targets with low maneuverability. Attack enemy ships from their broadside.
IDS_TIPS_AIRCRAFT_SQUADRON_TORPERS_DW_DE: This type of aircraft is armed with deepwater torpedoes that are efficient against targets with low maneuverability.\nHits only deep-draught ships.
IDS_TIPS_AIR_DEFENSE_DESCRIPTION: AA defenses and secondary batteries open fire automatically.\n\nTo prevent the tracers from exposing your position within a smoke screen, you can disable the AA and secondary guns using the [CMD_SWITCH_ATBA_AIRDEFENSE] key.
IDS_TIPS_AIR_DEFENSE_SECTOR_GAIN_DESCRIP:
Press [CMD_SET_PRIORITY_SECTOR] and select an AA sector to reinforce, depending on the side from which the enemy aircraft are approaching your ship.

This will decrease the efficiency of the other sectors.

Reinforcement will cease automatically.
IDS_TIPS_ARMAMENT_AP_DESCRIPTION:
Select AP shells by pressing [CMD_ARTILLERY_AMMO_1].

Effective against heavily armored targets.

If the armor is not thick enough, shells will over-penetrate and cause only minor damage.

Shells will ricochet if they impact with armor at too sharp an angle.
IDS_TIPS_ARMAMENT_CS_DESCRIPTION:
Select SAP shells by pressing [CMD_ARTILLERY_AMMO_0].

Effective against lightly armored targets.

In cases of non-penetrations or ricochets, no damage is dealt.
IDS_TIPS_ARMAMENT_HE_DESCRIPTION:
Select HE shells by pressing [CMD_ARTILLERY_AMMO_0].

Effective against lightly armored ships.

These shells have high chances of causing fire or incapacitating modules.
IDS_TIPS_ARMSRACE_DESCRIPTION: Buffs randomly appear on the map and are displayed as Key Areas.\n\nSeize buffs to enhance the performance characteristics of your team's ships and aircraft squadrons.
IDS_TIPS_ASW_DEPTH_CHARGES_DESCRIPTION: Once a hostile submarine's bearing has been taken, approach it and go in for the attack.
IDS_TIPS_ASW_DESCRIPTION: Your ship carries submarine detection equipment and depth charges.
IDS_TIPS_ASW_HYDROPHONE_DESCRIPTION: The Hydrophone indicates the location of a hostile submarine.\n\nThe closer a submarine is to the ship, the more frequently the incoming information on her location will be updated.
IDS_TIPS_BARRAGE_FIRE_DESCRIPTION: Increases the intensity of AA fire.
IDS_TIPS_BATTLESHIP_DESCRIPTION: Battleships carry the most powerful guns. They are slow and are not easy to maneuver, but this is well compensated for by their thick armor.\n\nTheir primary purpose is to destroy enemy ships with main battery fire.
IDS_TIPS_BINOCULARS_DESCRIPTION: To take better aim at your target, switch to the Binocular View by pressing [CMD_ART_CAMERA].\n\nUse the mouse wheel [KEY_MIDDLEMOUSE] to zoom in and out.
IDS_TIPS_CALL_FIGHTERS_DESCRIPTION: Patrol the area and automatically attack enemy aircraft.
IDS_TIPS_CAPACITY_DESCRIPTION: Used to determine the range at which the ship can be detected by the enemy. An indicator will be displayed when your ship is detected.
IDS_TIPS_CATAPULT_FIGHTER_DESCRIPTION: Follows the ship and automatically attacks enemy aircraft. Provides additional aerial reconnaissance.
IDS_TIPS_CRUISERS_DESCRIPTION: Good armor protection and powerful guns. Sufficient maneuverability enables these ships to dodge torpedoes from destroyers and avoid shells from battleships.\n\nThe duties expected of cruisers include fighting enemy destroyers and cruisers while providing artillery support and protecting allies with anti-aircraft fire.
IDS_TIPS_DEEP_TORPEDES_DESCRIPTION: Deepwater torpedoes can be selected by pressing [CMD_TORPEDOES_ANGLE].\n\nHit only deep-draught ships. Ineffective against destroyers. Have low detectability.
IDS_TIPS_DEFENSE_DESCRIPTION: Lead your targets by shooting ahead of them if they are moving. The longer the distance to your target, the greater the lead will be!
IDS_TIPS_DEPTH_CHARGES_DESCRIPTION:
Release depth charges by pressing the [CMD_SHOOT_DEPTH_CHARGES] key.

Effective against hostile submarines.
These charges have the potential to cause fires and flooding.
Released in groups.
IDS_TIPS_DESTROYERS_DESCRIPTION: Destroyers excel at surprise attacks through a deadly mix of speed, maneuverability, stealth, and astounding torpedo damage.\n\nCarry out torpedo attacks on enemy heavy ships and provide cover for allied forces by setting smoke screens.
IDS_TIPS_FIRE_AND_FLOODING_DESCRIPTION: Fire and flooding will damage your ship until resolved.\n\nUse the Damage Control Party consumable [CMD_CONSUMABLE_0] to accelerate fire and flooding recovery.
IDS_TIPS_FIRE_CORRECTIONER_DESCRIPTION: Extends the firing range of the main battery. Provides additional aerial reconnaissance.
IDS_TIPS_FORCING_DESCRIPTION: Temporarily increases the maximum speed of a ship.
IDS_TIPS_HEAL_FORSAGE_DESCRIPTION: Allows you, for a limited time, to use the aircraft's engine boost without the risk of overheating the engine.
IDS_TIPS_HYDROACUSTIC_SEARCH_DESCRIPTION: Increases the range of assured acquisition of enemy ships and torpedoes, including those within a smoke screen.
IDS_TIPS_MAIN_CALIBER_RELOAD_BOOST_DESCR: Temporarily accelerates the reload speed of the main battery guns
IDS_TIPS_MAIN_CALIBER_SHOOTING_DESCRIPTI:
Place the targeting reticle over an enemy ship and wait for the gun indicator to turn green—that's when the guns are ready to fire.

Hold [KEY_LEFTMOUSE] for sequential fire.
Double-click [KEY_LEFTMOUSE_DOUBLE] to fire a full salvo from all turrets.
IDS_TIPS_MINIMAP_DESCRIPTION: On the Minimap, your ship is displayed in white. Your allied and enemy ships are green and red, respectively. The same color schemes are applied to bases and capture points.\n\nUse the [MAP_SCALE_MINUS] and [MAP_SCALE_PLUS] keys to zoom the Minimap in and out.
IDS_TIPS_MODULES_DESCRIPTION:
Ship modules can be incapacitated or completely destroyed.

Use the Damage Control Party consumable to recover damaged modules instantly.

Destroyed modules can't be restored.
IDS_TIPS_MOVEMENT_UNDER_FIRE_DESCRIPTION: Maneuver by changing your speed and course to throw off the enemy's aim.
IDS_TIPS_POINTING_GUNS_DESCRIPTION: It takes time to traverse guns. Gun turrets will follow the view camera.
IDS_TIPS_REGENCREW_DESCRIPTION: When a ship runs out of Hit Points, she is destroyed.
IDS_TIPS_REGENERATE_PLANE_HEALTH_DESCRIP: Partially restores squadron HP.\nUsing it during enemy fighter attacks can save your aircraft from destruction.
IDS_TIPS_REPAIR_CONSUMABLE_01_DESCRIPTIO: Repairs damaged modules, puts out fires, and stops flooding.\n\nDon't rush to use the Damage Control Party consumable if you are under heavy fire.
IDS_TIPS_REPAIR_CONSUMABLE_02_DESCRIPTIO: Partially restores the ship's HP by repairing minor damage.\n\nThe gray zone on the HP indicator displays the amount of HP that can be restored.
IDS_TIPS_SEARCHING_RLS_DESCRIPTION: Increases the range of assured acquisition of enemy ships and torpedoes, including those within a smoke screen.
IDS_TIPS_SHIP_MANAGEMENT_DESCRIPTION: Control the speed at which your ship travels using the [CRUISE_SPEED_UP] and [CRUISE_SPEED_DOWN] keys.\n\nTo turn, press [CMD_MOVE_LEFT] and [CMD_MOVE_RIGHT].
IDS_TIPS_SHIP_MOVEMENT_DESCRIPTION: Ships respond slowly to commands to speed up or stop.\n\nPlan your actions and movement, and be prepared to turn in advance.
IDS_TIPS_SHOOTING_AP_DESCRIPTION: When firing AP shells [CMD_ARTILLERY_AMMO_1], aim your guns at the enemy ship's sides just below the main turrets and at the propulsion. The greater the angle between the shell path and the ship's armor, the higher the chances of non-penetrations and ricochets.
IDS_TIPS_SHOOTING_HE_DESCRIPTION: When firing HE shells [CMD_ARTILLERY_AMMO_0] aim at the enemy ship's superstructures.
IDS_TIPS_SMOKE_DESCRIPTION: Smoke screens conceal the exact position of you and your allied ships.
IDS_TIPS_SMOKE_GENERATOR_DESCRIPTION: Used to deploy a smoke screen behind your ship, reducing the risk of detection by the enemy.
IDS_TIPS_START_TORPEDOES_DESCRIPTION:
Lead your target before launching torpedoes. Lock onto a target, and you'll see a white lead wedge.

To change the width of the spread, press [CMD_TORPEDOES_ANGLE] again.

Before you press your torpedo release, make sure your teammates are not in its path.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_ACOUSTIC_TORPEDO_DESC: Select torpedo armament by pressing the [CMD_SUBMARINE_TORPEDO] key.\n\nThe efficiency of a torpedo salvo increases when a sonar ping hits special indicators on the target ship.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_ANTI_SUBMARINE_WARFAR: Hostile destroyers and light cruisers carry submarine detection equipment and depth charges.\n\nYour best tactic would be to stay away from them.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_CRUSH_DEPTH_DESCRIPTI:
To activate the consumable, press the [CMD_CONSUMABLE_1] key.

Temporarily allows a submarine to dive to its maximum depth.

While at this depth, the submarine receives less damage from depth charge explosions and is invisible to enemy Hydrophones.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_DEPTH_AND_VISIBILITY_: The deeper a submarine dives, the better her concealment
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_DEPTH_CONTROL_DESCRIP: Press the [CMD_MOVE_DOWN] key to make a submarine dive, and [CMD_MOVE_UP] to ascend.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_ENERGY_MANAGEMENT_DES: Battery charge is consumed by active sonar, and when a submarine is moving underwater.\n\nTo recharge the battery, slow down to 1/4 of the submarine's speed, or ascend to the surface.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_IMPULSE_DESCRIPTION:
Select the sonar by pressing the [CMD_PINGER_GUN_0] key.

Sonar pings help a submarine detect target ships and temporarily increase the efficiency of any torpedoes that have just been fired.

To swap between ping types, use the [CMD_PINGER_GUN_0] key.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_TORPEDO_BULGE_IGNORIN: Hitting two special indicators on a hostile ship's hull allows torpedoes to temporarily ignore the target ship's anti-torpedo protection.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_TORPEDO_HOMING_DESCRI: A successful hit with a sonar ping on one of a ship’s two special indicators will make the torpedo home in on it.
IDS_TIPS_SUBMARINE_UNMASKING_DESCRIPTION: Emitting a sonar ping has a negative effect on a submarine's concealment.
IDS_TIPS_TARGET_CAPTURING_DESCRIPTION: You can deliver fire with greater accuracy when the enemy ship is locked in your crosshairs. Press [CMD_FIXING_TARGET_POSITION] to switch to another target.
IDS_TIPS_TORPEDOES_DESCRIPTION: Select torpedo armament by pressing [CMD_TORPEDOES_ANGLE].\n\nMost effective against large armored enemy ships. Maneuverable ships have high chances of dodging a torpedo attack.
IDS_TIPS_TORPEDOES_MOVEMENT_DISTANCE_DES: Remember that torpedo [CMD_TORPEDOES_ANGLE] range is limited. Launch torpedoes when your ship is close enough to the enemy.
IDS_TIPS_TORPEDOES_RELOAD_SYSTEM_DESCRIP: When activated, this consumable significantly reduces the reload time of torpedo tubes.

IDS_TOOLTIP_BATTLE_BONUS_DAILY_DESCRIPTI: Reward for a victory. Available daily.
IDS_TOOLTIP_BATTLE_BONUS_ONCE_DESCRIPTIO: Reward for a victory. Can be obtained only once.
IDS_TOOLTIP_BATTLE_LEVEL_RANGE: A specific set of battle tiers that the matchmaker uses to place this ship in battle.

IDS_TOOLTIP_BATTLE_STATS_TEAM_REPORT: Battle results of all players on both teams

IDS_TOOLTIP_WAVE_ENERGY_COST: Battery charge consumed to emit a sonar ping

IDS_TRAINING_LEVEL: Increase the number of skill points to

IDS_TRAINING_ROOM_ORGANIZER_NAME_TOO_SHO: Search query must contain at least three characters
IDS_TRAINING_ROOM_PASSWORD_INFO: If this Training Room is protected with a password, it will still be displayed in the list of training rooms.
IDS_TRAINING_ROOM_PASSWORD_WRONG_CHARACT: You have entered an invalid character.\nUse Latin characters, numbers, and underscores.

IDS_TUTORIAL_BATTLE_DESCRIPTION: Master the basics of ship control and weapons.\nCan be completed again before your battle count exceeds %(amount)s.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_01: Bastion is a battle mode in which teams of players fight against each other while receiving support from onshore installations.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_02: The map has several sectors [icon_1] which enclose forts [icon_2] and surveillance stations [icon_3].
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_03: Capture the sector to make the respective installations become your allies.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_04: A fort [icon_4] is an onshore installation with high HP, armed with artillery and AA defense guns. Allied forts [icon_5] will fire at your enemies.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_05: A surveillance station [icon_6] helps your team detect enemies within its spotting range.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_06: Attack onshore installations to reset the capture progress of the respective sector and suppress their operation.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_07: When suppressed, the fort [icon_7] ceases its attack. The spotting range of a suppressed surveillance station [icon_8] decreases.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_08: Onshore installations automatically recover from a suppressed state and restore their operational readiness after some time.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_09: Your mission is to destroy all enemy ships or score 1,000 points before the enemy team.
IDS_TUTOR_BASTION_HEADER: Welcome to the Bastion game mode
IDS_UNABLED_ACTION_WITH_PLAYER: Actions for this player are unavailable
IDS_UNABLE_TO_CREATE_TRAINING: Unable to create a Training Room.
IDS_UNABLE_TO_CREATE_TRAINING_WHEN_IN_DI: You cannot create a Training Room while you are in a Division.
IDS_UNABLE_TO_CREATE_TRAINING_WHEN_IN_PA: You cannot create a Training Room when assembling for a Team Battle.
IDS_UNABLE_TO_DISASSIGN_CREW: No vacant places in the Reserve. Free up a place in the Reserve or expand it.
IDS_UNABLE_TO_EXCLUDE_PLAYER_OUT_OF_PART: It is impossible to remove a player before the Team Battle is over.
IDS_UNABLE_TO_START_VOTE_TILL_CURRENT_NO: It is impossible to start a new vote in the Team before the current one is over.

IDS_UNLOCKS_12: By mounting upgrades, you can improve the parameters of your ships.
IDS_UNLOCKS_13: Commander skills help to improve your ship's current parameters and open up new abilities.
IDS_UNLOCKS_1514: Mount camouflage and signals on your ship to boost her combat characteristics.
IDS_UNLOCKS_16: Participate in Ranked Battles and demonstrate your true worth!
IDS_UNLOCKS_20: Explore strengths and weaknesses of the armor layout.
IDS_UNLOCKS_21: You can earn up to three containers with rewards each day.
IDS_UNLOCKS_22: Accomplish Campaign missions on your journey to the ultimate reward.
IDS_UNLOCKS_23: Sell any modules, upgrades, and other inventory items that you are no longer using.
IDS_UNLOCKS_2827: Join a Clan and battle on within a cohesive team!
IDS_UNLOCKS_3029: Exchange resources for new game items.
IDS_UNLOCKS_3124: Team up with other players to participate in Operations with unique scenarios.
IDS_UNLOCKS_5: Researching ships is much easier now. Use Free Experience Points (Free XP) to research any ship or module.
IDS_UNLOCKS_8: Receive additional XP and credits for completing daily missions in Random and Ranked Battles.
IDS_UNLOCKS_9: Complete combat missions and get valuable rewards.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_12_0: Upgrades allow you to build on the strengths of your ship while adjusting its weaknesses.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_12_1: The higher a ship's tier; the more upgrades she can take advantage of.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_13_0: Commander skills help to improve your ship's current parameters and open up new abilities.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_13_1: A Commander gets skill points for experience (XP) earned in battle.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_13_2: When assigned to another ship, a Commander requires retraining. Until retraining is complete, the effect of mastered skills is reduced.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_1514_0: Camouflage reduces your ship's detectability and decreases the firing accuracy of the enemy. By using signals, you get more XP and credits per battle.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_1514_1: Camouflage and signals are earned as rewards for your achievements in battle, or can be obtained for game currency.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_1514_2: Mounted signals and applied camouflages are spent in battles. Enable auto-resupply so that after each battle, replacement signals or camouflage are automatically mounted on your ship.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_16_0: Ranked Battles are only available during an active Ranked Battles season.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_16_1: By climbing to the next Rank, you get signals, credits and much more. The higher your Rank, the more valuable rewards you get, and the more challenging battles will become.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_16_2: Keep track of your progress on the Profile tab in the Ranks screen and in the battle statistics on the Summary screen.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_17_0: Ships of various types and nations are available to you: sneaky destroyers, versatile cruisers, heavily armored battleships, and carriers with fast and devastating aircraft on board. Choose your role in battle!
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_17_1: For your battle prowess, you earn XP and credits after every battle. You can use this to research and purchase ships, or upgrade your ships by purchasing new modules.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_1_0: Fight against bots in cooperation with other players.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_21_0: You can earn up to three containers with rewards each day. Containers are granted for XP you earn in battle.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_21_1: Try your luck for a supercontainer with an exceptionally valuable reward.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_22_0: Accomplish Campaign missions as you work your way to the ultimate reward.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_22_1: Missions consist of tasks that will grant you stars when completed. Stars grant access to subsequent missions.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_22_2: Any required, but missing stars can be obtained by completing tasks again.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_22_3: You can carry out up to three tasks concurrently.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_23_0: Sell any modules, upgrades, and other inventory items that you are no longer using.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_2827_0: To participate in battles between Clans, you need to join a Clan first.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_2827_1: Clan Battles are only available during an active season of Clan Battles.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_2827_2: Win Clan Battles to earn Clan Rating points and climb the groups and leagues.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_2827_3: Earn Oil and develop your Naval Base to increase your permanent economic bonuses.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_2827_4: Create training rooms and participate in Training Battles to hone your skills of team cooperation.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_3029_0: The Armory is an in-game shop where you can exchange resources (and, in some cases—doubloons and credits) for special upgrades, signal flags, camouflage patterns, containers, and Premium ships.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_3029_1: Go to the Coupons tab in the Armory and activate your discount for various items.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_3029_2: Earn temporary resources and exchange them for valuable items that are available under special tabs dedicated to in-game events.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_3124_0: Operations are battles that follow unique scenarios.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_3124_1: Earn stars by completing secondary tasks. A reward is issued for every star earned.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_3124_2: Your allies can be automatically selected for the Operation of the Week. To complete other Operations, you need to assemble a Division.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_3_0: Fight against real players. The matchmaker will create teams randomly.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_5_0: If you don't have enough XP to research a ship or a module, use your Free XP.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_5_1: You now receive Free XP equivalent to 5% of XP earned in each battle.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_5_2: You can convert undistributed XP earned with Elite and Premium ships into Free XP.
IDS_UNLOCKS_DESCRIPTION_9_0: Complete combat missions and get valuable rewards.

IDS_USA_ARC_BRANCH_DESCR: A new line of cruisers has just been added to the U.S.A. tech tree. The new ships are available for research and purchase!
IDS_USA_ARC_COMPANY_AND_COLLECTION_DESCR: Get a chance to mount a second flag and select a custom color scheme for the camouflages of U.S.A. ships as a reward for completing the collection. Finish the campaign to get the unique commander William F. Halsey Jr.
IDS_USA_ARC_COMPANY_COMMANDER_DESCRIPTIO: A unique Commander with improved skills, talents, and personalization options
IDS_USA_ARC_MARAPHONE_DESCR: Complete the combat missions to get U.S.A. Tier VII cruiser Indianapolis
IDS_USE_DEFAULT_CONTROLS: Default control scheme for aircraft carriers

IDS_USE_STATIC_CROSSHAIRS: Use static crosshairs with a fixed width for the horizontal crosshair line
IDS_VICTORY_PERCENT_TOOLTIP: Ratio of battles won to the total number of battles played
IDS_VISIBILITY_DIST_BY_GK_IN_SMOKE_HUD_T: After firing main guns in smoke

IDS_VISIBLE_FOR_OTHER_PLAYERS_PARTY: Enable this status to include your name in the \"Looking to join a Team Battle\" list so that other players can invite you as a mercenary.
